com.hannesdorfmann.mosby

Class MosbyFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.MosbyFragment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Dagger1MosbyFragment, MvpFragment

    public abstract class MosbyFragment
extends Fragment
    A base fragment that uses Icepick, Butterknife and FragmentArgs. Instead of overriding onCreateView(LayoutInflater, ViewGroup, Bundle) you can also simply have override getLayoutRes() and return your desired layout resource, which will be inflated.

    Future initialization can be done in onViewCreated(View, Bundle) method (don't forget to call super.onViewCreated()), which is called after the view has been created, Butterknife has "injected" views, FragmentArgs has been set and Icepick has restored savedInstanceState. init() is called from onViewCreated(View, Bundle) which is called after onCreateView(LayoutInflater, ViewGroup, Bundle)

    If you want to use dependency injection libraries like dagger you can override injectDependencies() and implement dependency injection right there

    Since:
    1.0.0

        protected int getLayoutRes()

        Returns:
